data.title: AVS Symposia Locations and Chairs
data.text:
The 6th symposium in 1959 was the first designated as the National Symposium; the name has been applied retroactively to the earlier symposia. The term was used through 1997.

Since 1998, it has been the International Symposium but the numbering system is continuous; e.g. it was the 44th National Symposium in 1997 and the 45th International Symposium in 1998.

*Everett Brown was the Symposium Arrangements Chair for the first Symposium but he died in 1954 and was replaced by Lyle Backer

+George Murphy resigned at the end of 1954 and John Durant was Arrangements Chair for the 1955 symposium.

# This was the first Symposium with the title National Symposium.

$ Bill Bottoms was the official program chair in 1977 but "vanished" before the abstract selection meeting and the program was organized by John Yates and Galen Fisher.

(a) Combined with the 2nd International Congress on Vacuum Science & Technology

(b) Combined with the 5th International Vacuum Congress & 1st International Conference on Solid Surfaces. Luther Preuss was the General Chair
